title: Chevron, Microsoft share gains lead Dow's nearly 100-point climb
text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average is up Friday afternoon with shares of Chevron and Microsoft leading the way for the blue-chip average. Shares of Chevron 
        CVX,
        +0.89%
       and Microsoft 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       are contributing to the index's intraday rally, as the Dow 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       was most recently trading 97 points, or 0.3%, higher. Chevron's shares are up $4.07 (2.8%) while those of Microsoft have gained $8.28, or 2.1%, combining for a roughly 81-point boost for the Dow. Other components contributing significantly to the gain include Caterpillar 
        CAT,
        +0.49%,
       American Express 
        AXP,
        -0.03%,
       and Salesforce 
        CRM,
        -0.07%.
       A $1 move in any of the Dow's 30 components equates to a 6.59-point swing.
